IMO Routing Measures in the Baltic Sea – Applicable to cargo vessels navigating major designated shipping lanes, including those connecting Klaipėda, Kiel, Świnoujście, and Ystad; these routes are established under international maritime safety guidelines to separate opposing traffic flows and reduce collision risk in congested waters.
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels of this size and draught operating without hazardous cargo typically follow straight, predictable paths along predefined maritime corridors in open-water conditions, where route adherence is optimized for fuel efficiency and navigational safety.
